page.title: 06Farms
page.content: In our section of the village there are 7 farms. They vary in acreage from 90- 430 (859 acres total).They are arable farms, but 2 farmers keep chickens to sell eggs or for own use and 1 farmer keeps bullocks and pigs for fattening. One farm is run more as a market garden The main crops are barley (for brewing) wheat, sugar beet (for BSC at Bury) oil seed rape and potatoes. The land in Gt. Barton was part of the Bunbury Estate, which was sold off in 1914 in 100 lots and bought up by others, including the County Council which divided up its land into small holdings for men returning from the war The farms are run by families with per- haps one other workman, most of the farmers are tenants.There are about 9ac of woodland in this area.
